etymology.description: semantic: 人(人) (rén, "person") + phonetic: 立(立) (lì, "stand") = person standing -> position, rank
etymology.interpretation: The character 位(位) (wèi, "position") combines 人(人) (rén, "person") to signify a person and 立(立) (lì, "stand") to indicate the act of standing or taking a position. This reflects the idea of assuming a role or status.

examples.chinese: 他坐在第一位(他坐在第一位)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zuò zài dì yī wèi.
examples.english: He sits in the first position.

examples.chinese: 老师点名时(老師點名時)，这位学生总是表现出色(這位學生總是表現出色)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎoshī diǎnmíng shí, zhè wèi xuéshēng zǒng shì biǎoxiàn chūsè.
examples.english: When the teacher calls roll, this student always performs outstandingly.

examples.chinese: 在会议上(在會議上)，他占据了重要的一位(他佔據了重要的一位)。
examples.pinyin: Zài huìyì shàng, tā zhànjù le zhòngyào de yī wèi.
examples.english: During the meeting, he occupied an important position.
